intro: Razoumofskya campylopoda, commonly known as the narrow-leafed sedge, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes grass-like plants known as sedges. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered flower heads. It typically grows in wetland or marshy environments, thriving in moist soil conditions. Its botanical features make it an important species in ecological studies of wetland ecosystems.
